Triage Nurse (Registered Nurse) – Unique Opportunity for Accelerated Career Progression - South Western Ambulance Service (SWAST) – NHS Devon, UK
We are the Devon Alliance for International Recruitment and we are part of NHS. We are delighted to work alongside South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust (SWAST) to recruit Registered Nurses to join their Emergency Operation Centres as a Triage Nurse based in their Emergency Operation Centre in Exeter, Devon in the beautiful south west of England, UK.
Unique Opportunity – Triage Nurse (Registered Nurse)
We are recruiting Registered Nurses to join SWAST’s Emergency Operation Centres as a ‘Triage Nurse’. As a Triage Nurse, you will be responsible for providing clinical advice and guidance to colleagues, patients and service users via telephone triage to establish appropriate care pathways.
This role is part of a wider team of clinical professionals, including Doctors, Paramedics and Specialist Practitioners. You will provide remote clinical support via telephone, and support decision making with emergency ambulance crews who are on the scene with patients.
Progression opportunity:
Upon obtaining your NMC UK PIN you will progress into a Band 6 Triage Nurse £33,706 to £40,588pa (rather than a Band 5 general Registered Nurse) with the scope to progress to a Band 7 Senior Nurse £41,659 to £47,672 pa within 12 to 24 months. This is a rare and unique opportunity for international Nurses to join South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust at this exciting time. The South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust has also committed to a 5-year employment visa for the successful candidate, with the option to apply for permanent residency after the initial 5-year term.
Interview and required work experience:
The right candidate will have IELTS at level 7.0 or OET at a B, be confident in communicating using the telephone, and have a minimum of 2 years’ experience in a critical or emergency care setting. All Registered Nurses must also register with the UK’s Nursing and Midwifery Council (NMC):
For an insight into the day in the life of a Triage Nurse, please follow this link to see a short video; Join Us, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=io4DnDAN9BQ
SWAST – Exeter, Devon UK
The South Western Ambulance Service (SWAST) is responsible for providing ambulance services for the National Health Service across South West England. SWAST responds to medical emergencies at all times of the day and night, operating a 24-hour clinical response to urgent ‘999’ calls to ensure patients receive the right care as quickly as possible – wherever and whenever they need it!
SWAST’s Emergency Operation Centre, where you will be working, is located in the city of Exeter. Exeter is situated on the River Exe and is a small, historic city which is full of character and has a great cultural scene. Exeter is the capital city of Devon and provides the county with a central base for education, medicine, religion, commerce and culture. It has an array of historic architecture, including Roman ruins, the historical Guildhall and most notably the Cathedral, St Peter's Cathedral which dates back to the 12th century and sits at the heart of the city, dominating the skyline.
Our generous offer includes:
· Sponsorship and paid visa
· Paid flight to the UK
· Band 6 salary (£33,706 to £40,588pa), on receipt of NMC PIN
· 2 months free accommodation (single person accommodation) is provided
· Airport transfers, food vouchers, phone card and bank account
· Free accommodation for two months
· NMC registration and IELTS/OET fees reimbursed
· Full pastoral package
· Free healthcare and schooling
· Opportunities for career development
· Eligibility to apply for family visa
· And much more!
We will hold virtual interviews in 2023 over MS Teams - we hope to meet you then!
www.devon-alliance.com
NB: We adhere to the World Health Organisation's guidelines on ethical recruitment. If you are in one of the 47 countries which is on the 'Red' or 'Amber' list, we are truly sorry but we cannot accept your application.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: QAR148,490.01 - QAR178,808.29 per year

Virtual Interviews

Nursing in an Emergency setting: 2 years (Required)

Nursing License (Required)

Looking for a great place to work? Want to be appreciated for what you do and have a work life balance? Are you looking for a place to grow and develop your career?
This may be the place for you!
Your passion and energy will be infection as you welcoming our guests and support them through their check in and check out procedure. Your natural down to earth manner will result in being able to manage guest expectations in a fast and busy environment. With a keen eye for detail you will not miss a step in the procedures. Managing payments will be second nature and you will have excellent data entry skills to support accurate reports.
What will I be doing?
· Greet and welcome guests, visitors, suppliers, answer telephone calls providing a warm, timely welcome in line with our brand standards.
· Answers guest related queries and provides information for promotions, room prices, activities and events in the surrounding area to provide accurate information to guests
· Ensure payments are made with according to the cash handling procedures and Process accurately and efficiently all reservations and cancellations
· Identify corporate leads and build long-term relationships
· Drive online name mentions and promote customer feedback
· Understand the online guest’s feedback and explore options for improvement
· Carry out general office duties, including correspondence, emails and filing to ensure the smooth running of the reception area Maintain appropriate stock of supplies and reception stationaries
· Effectively communicate with all departments on all guests’ requests and complaints for smooth service delivery
· Ensure safety of all guest in line with the safety procedures and guideline
Requirements
Customer-oriented approach.
· Excellent communication skills.
· Strong attention to details.
· Flexible, agile and able to work under pressure.
· Ability to work both independently and in a team.
· Proactive and excellent organizational skills.
· Ability to provide exceptional customer service to our guests.
Experience
· You will be likely to have minimum of one year experience in Reception department of a hotel.
· Knowledge of Opera (PMS).
· High School Diploma preferred.
· Arabic language is an advantage
Benefits
We offer a competitive salary package, accommodation, transportation, medical insurance which includes dental, air tickets, and hours which offer you a work life balance.
Along with this we have many examples of how those that work with us have grown and developed their career throughout our company. So if you are committed and driven and want to develop into other areas then we will support you to do this.
At Premier Inn, we know the importance of creating a culture which brings the experience to life for both our customers and our team and this is supported by strong company values. We employ people that not only believe in our values but also have the passion to live and breathe them, and always put the customer in the heart of everything we do.
We want Premier Inn to be a place where people’s skills and careers grow as fast as we do. A place where everyone has the opportunities to develop and achieve their dreams. We put emphasis on a ‘promote from within’ culture and continuously strive to create a supportive and engaging environment in which our team can thrive and deliver.

The AMOURION GROUP is a privately owned, highly experienced global company, that over the years has built a reputation for integrity, transparency, and innovation in the educational sector.
Our expertise spans over eight separate, but complementary divisions in the Educational, Corporate, Marketing and Career Counselling sectors. We are committed to adding value through our entrepreneurial, forward-thinking approach and our clients and partners take supreme comfort from our successful track record.
We are hiring a dedicated and hardworking individual as a Telecaller to join our Sales Department.
· Your main goal is to boost our sales by reaching out to the existing customers as well as potential customers.
· You are responsible for solving questions in regard to the product or service provided by the company.
· You should collect desired information from the clients and maintain healthy relations with them.
· You are required to understand the customer’s requirements and demands and close the sales deal efficiently.
· You are also required to write down important information provided by the customer and follow up with them on a regular basis.
· You should be an excellent communicator along with convincing abilities. Great report writing skills, amazing negotiation skills, and phenomenal telephone etiquette are essential for this position.
Responsibilities
Contacting existing customers as well as prospective customers using scripts.
Obtaining customer information and other relevant data.
Asking questions to the customer and understanding their specifications.
Resolving queries and issues related to the products and services.
Making recordings of all the sales phone calls and sales deals.
Taking and processing product orders in a professional manner.
Maintaining the database of the customers on a regular basis.
Suggesting solutions based on customer’s needs and requirements.
Minimum 2 years of experience within the Sales field.
Studying the details of each training module for all of our brands and communicating it with clients.
Obtaining and updating lists of individuals' contact details.
Calling active owner/tenants to encourage their property for listing, rental and sales
Noting important details of each conversation.
Recording all successful and unsuccessful attempts to close sales.
Attending regular team meetings to clarify progress and performance-related expectations.

Job title: Team Leader- Telesales
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Direct Hire
Arabic Speakers are encouraging to apply.*
Job Location: Dubai, United Arab Emirates
Job Brief
The telesales team leader is the staff whose role is to lead and direct the telesales team to make high sales and enjoy good patronage from clients; to obtain excellent records in call quality and sales delivery.
He/she directs the telesales team as they contact customers via the telephone to make sales transactions and support field sales.
The job description of the telesales team leader entails monitoring call time, call quality, and revenue targets, among other things.
As expert sales personnel, he/she makes efforts to build strong and lasting relationships with clients in order for them to not only make one time purchase, but continuous purchase as these increases company sales.
Understanding the market terrain, the leader of a telesales team studies the needs, wants of customers, and makes available commodities that will meet these needs so as to draw them toward making high sales.
He/she develops leads from prospective buyers who show the slightest interest in products offered by the organization.
To do this, he/she outlines specific questions to be answered by prospective customers in order to determine their level of interest in buying the products at given prices and follows them up.
In order to increase company sales, telesales team leaders contact already established customers about new products that arrive in the company, intimate them with their uses and benefits and inquire if they might be interested in buying them.
This is done using customer database, contacting them based on their purchase history.
Telesales Team Leader Job Description
Facilitate direct sales by instructing team members to inform existing customers about new arrivals in the company and encouraging them to make sales.
Inform customers about all products in the company, their uses and benefits.
Take orders made by customers and ensure that they are successfully delivered to them in due time.
Follow up sales delivery to customers and inquire about their user experience of goods purchased, making use of their feedback in rating customer satisfaction
Ensure proper documentation in the information system in due time and check through them for accuracy
Interact closely with other team members in the course of work to ensure that everyone is carried along and updated on work progress in order to achieve maximum results
Ensure that customers are treated cordially and are held in high esteem in order to make them patronize the company continuously
Create good relationship with team members and motivate them to put in their best to work in order to achieve maximum results
Evaluate sales records periodically to make balances and ensure that sales figures tally with number of goods sold
Coach team members on the best ways to carry out their duties by transferring expert knowledge to them to boost their skills
Telesales Team Leader Requirements: Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities for Career Success
Telesales team leaders need to have the following attributes to be effective on the job:
Exhibit good marketing skills to make high sales.
Excellent presentation skills to convince customers about new products.
Good motivational skills to bring out the best in team members.
Good managerial skills to lead the team successfully.
Ability to make good sales decision.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: AED9,000.00 - AED10,000.00 per month
Language:
Arabic (Required)
French (Preferred)

Preparing clients for a return to work.
Educating caregivers and family members of clients on patient care.
Evaluating results and progress of occupational therapy on clients.
Maintaining professional knowledge and the technical progress to provide clients with the best treatment program available.
We are complying with federal, state, and local certification requirements.
Evaluating patient condition regarding physical and basic mental health.

Excellent interpersonal communication skills.

Triage Nurse (Registered Nurse) – Unique Opportunity for Accelerated Career Progression - South Western Ambulance Service (SWAST) – NHS Devon, UK
We are the Devon Alliance for International Recruitment and we are part of NHS. We are delighted to work alongside South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust (SWAST) to recruit Registered Nurses to join their Emergency Operation Centres as a Triage Nurse based in their Emergency Operation Centre in Exeter, Devon in the beautiful south west of England, UK.
Unique Opportunity – Triage Nurse (Registered Nurse)
We are recruiting Registered Nurses to join SWAST’s Emergency Operation Centres as a ‘Triage Nurse’. As a Triage Nurse, you will be responsible for providing clinical advice and guidance to colleagues, patients and service users via telephone triage to establish appropriate care pathways.
This role is part of a wider team of clinical professionals, including Doctors, Paramedics and Specialist Practitioners. You will provide remote clinical support via telephone, and support decision making with emergency ambulance crews who are on the scene with patients.
Progression opportunity:
Upon obtaining your NMC UK PIN you will progress into a Band 6 Triage Nurse £33,706 to £40,588pa (rather than a Band 5 general Registered Nurse) with the scope to progress to a Band 7 Senior Nurse £41,659 to £47,672 pa within 12 to 24 months. This is a rare and unique opportunity for international Nurses to join South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust at this exciting time. The South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust has also committed to a 5-year employment visa for the successful candidate, with the option to apply for permanent residency after the initial 5-year term.
Interview and required work experience:
The right candidate will have IELTS at level 7.0 or OET at a B, be confident in communicating using the telephone, and have a minimum of 2 years’ experience in a critical or emergency care setting. All Registered Nurses must also register with the UK’s Nursing and Midwifery Council (NMC):
For an insight into the day in the life of a Triage Nurse, please follow this link to see a short video; Join Us, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=io4DnDAN9BQ
SWAST – Exeter, Devon UK
The South Western Ambulance Service (SWAST) is responsible for providing ambulance services for the National Health Service across South West England. SWAST responds to medical emergencies at all times of the day and night, operating a 24-hour clinical response to urgent ‘999’ calls to ensure patients receive the right care as quickly as possible – wherever and whenever they need it!
SWAST’s Emergency Operation Centre, where you will be working, is located in the city of Exeter. Exeter is situated on the River Exe and is a small, historic city which is full of character and has a great cultural scene. Exeter is the capital city of Devon and provides the county with a central base for education, medicine, religion, commerce and culture. It has an array of historic architecture, including Roman ruins, the historical Guildhall and most notably the Cathedral, St Peter's Cathedral which dates back to the 12th century and sits at the heart of the city, dominating the skyline.
Our generous offer includes:
· Sponsorship and paid visa
· Paid flight to the UK
· Band 6 salary (£33,706 to £40,588pa), on receipt of NMC PIN
· 2 months free accommodation (single person accommodation) is provided
· Airport transfers, food vouchers, phone card and bank account
· Free accommodation for two months
· NMC registration and IELTS/OET fees reimbursed
· Full pastoral package
· Free healthcare and schooling
· Opportunities for career development
· Eligibility to apply for family visa
· And much more!
We will hold virtual interviews in 2023 over MS Teams - we hope to meet you then!
www.devon-alliance.com
NB: We adhere to the World Health Organisation's guidelines on ethical recruitment. If you are in one of the 47 countries which is on the 'Red' or 'Amber' list, we are truly sorry but we cannot accept your application.

Role Summary
Looking for a dedicated, enthusiastic, committed, and dynamic teacher to join the department at School.
The primary role of a teacher is to deliver classroom instruction that helps students learn. To accomplish this, teachers must prepare effective lessons, grade student work and offer feedback, manage classroom materials, productively navigate the curriculum, and collaborate with other staff. The main goals are to help students progress in their academics, learn to take responsibility for their assignments and encourage necessary life skills that carry into adulthood.
About SSIS
Shining Star International School is a high performing International School in Abu Dhabi, fully accredited with CBSE- the largest examination conducting entity in the world..
Our students receive a sound and holistic education across a wide range of subjects and extra-curricular activities, which helps them to develop and hone a broad range of skills.
Shining Star International School is all inclusive private school established in 2014 in Musaffah, Abu Dhabi. Currently serving the needs of the local and international expatriate community it follows the CBSE curriculum and its students are encouraged to embark on a voyage of discovery that uncovers hidden talents in their niche areas of interest.
As they grow our ‘Shining Stars’ become beacons of light within their own peer groups and are taught how to use the knowledge and wisdom gained during their time in the school to benefit the people they associate with and the world at large.
Key Work Responsibilities
· Implement instructional activities that contribute to a climate where students are actively engaged in meaningful learning experiences.
· Inform students of disciplinary rules set by the School and personally make sure that any misconduct is handled appropriately.
· Ensure proper maintenance of school properties. Take full responsibility for damages, if any, in their class room property and report the cause of damage of the facility immediately or else take the responsibility to replace or fix the damage.
· Identify, select and modify instructional resources to meet the needs of the students with varying backgrounds, learning styles, and special needs.
· Maintain effective and efficient record keeping procedures.
· Provide a positive environment in which students are encouraged to be actively engaged in the learning process.
· Ensure the note books and assessment papers are corrected and recorded for performance tracking, progress recording and for future reference.
· Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with students, parents and other professionals on a regular basis.
· Collaborate with colleagues to enhance the instructional environment, establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with students, parents and the school.
· Model professional and ethical standards when dealing with students, parents, colleagues and community.
· Assume responsibility for meeting their course and school-wide students’ performance goals.
· Demonstrate progress in student performance.
· Participate in training and presentations on online teaching.
· Meet professional obligations through efficient work habits such as: meeting deadlines, honoring schedules and coordinating.
· Participate in extracurricular activities such as social activities, sporting activities, House and student organizations.
· Participate in department and school meetings, parent meetings.
· Keep updated with developments in subject area, teaching resources and methods and make relevant changes to instructional plans and activities.
· Identify and select different instructional resources and methods to meet students' varying needs.
· Understand that responsibilities are subject to having performance goals and targets established as part of the annual performance planning process or as the result of organizational planning.
· Prepares and moderates question papers for school examinations.
· Upload Lesson Plans-weekly plans, Mid Term Plans, Yearly plans, worksheets, School academic calendar, events and activity calendar ,Circulars and notices in the school ERP portal( Eth –DC)
· Perform other responsibilities which may be assigned by the school authorities from time to time.
· Responsible for Academic excellence of students.
· Collaborates with peers for the purpose of implementing and maintaining curricular and co-curricular programs for students and personal development
· Participates in peer observation and performance tracking.
Benefits
Excellent Remuneration Package, Competitive tax-free salary, 50% of on child education, private medical insurance, end of Service Gratuity, paid holidays.
Job Type: Full-time
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: AED3,500.00 - AED5,500.00 per month
Ability to commute/relocate:
Abu Dhabi: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

JOB PURPOSE:
Reporting to the Service Manager, the Storeman is responsible for administering the operations of a store.
The Storeman will be responsible for all incoming deliveries, shipment and safe keeping of all stock located within the warehouse.
They will ensure inventory items are available when required by controlling and monitoring the movement of all inventory items.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Receives, identifies and verifies a variety of heavy machinery parts
Establishes standards and methods for packaging and storing parts
Ensure parts are kept in good condition and are repaired or replaced as necessary
Select proper storage areas in bins, racks, shelves, floor or depot areas
Maintains catalogues of available stock items
Uses inventory management software to maintain inventory
Arranges stock according to company requirements and established procedures
Controls the distribution of supplies and material through inventory control cards and automated systems
Determines items and quantities of stock to be purchased and maintained
Identify suppliers and obtain quotes of prices for parts to be purchased. Research new parts, substitute products and pricing
Working closely with the finance department when purchasing parts
Prepares purchase requisitions and assigns account codes for the replacement of stock
Maintains records and files such as invoices, order numbers, receiving date and shipping dates
Perform weekly cycle counts, quarterly inventory, mid and year-end inventory
Prepare regular inventory reports
Oversees the delivery of parts according to the established schedule
Unloads parts from trucks by hand or motorised equipment
Inspects items for defects, damages and quantity against delivery documents
Resolves discrepancies in requisitions, purchase orders, and delivery reports
Makes claims with transport companies if delivered parts has been damaged
QUALIFICATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
The chosen candidate will meet ALL the essential criteria below:
ESSENTIAL
High school diploma or above
Strong track record in storekeeping
Well versed in the practices of maintaining inventory such as receiving, storing and issuing materials, supplies, tools, and equipment
Good knowledge of inventory management software
Knowledge of computer systems such as the Microsoft Office suite e.g. Word and Excel
Knowledge of the methods and techniques used to maintain a safe working environment, including the safe operation of materials handling equipment
Experience handling inventory for construction, heavy machinery or plant parts and tools and supplies
DESIRABLE
IPAF Operator Licence
Forklift Licence
PERSON SPECIFICATIONS:
Ability to fluently communicate in English - both verbally and in writing
Ability and willingness to work in a warehouse environment with occasional work in an office setting and outdoors
Ability to work safely and efficiently under pressure
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: QAR4,000.00 - QAR4,500.00 per month
Experience:
Storeman: 3 years (Preferred)

Position – Senior Accountant
Our company is looking for a qualified Senior accountant to streamline the flow of business operations.
We seek an accountant manager with in-depth knowledge and experience in finance and operations, excelling at accounting, analysis, and business operations. It's important to have someone who can learn quickly, has a track record of success, and inspires others to do the same. A successful candidate for the position must be a team leader with a sharp mind and the ability to coach, advise, motivate, and create and maintain a high-performing team.
Responsibilities and Duties
Prepare, examine, and analyze accounting records, financial statements, and other financial reports to assess accuracy, completeness, and conformance to reporting and procedural standards.

Preparation and Management of letters of credit, cash flow and project accounting.

To Ensure Computerized Accounting and Documentation Entries.
Assist with challenging client requests or issue escalations as needed.
Building and maintaining strong, long-lasting client relationships

Job Description
Responsible for coordinating and liaising between the company and Government organizations/authorities and providing a key interface between the two.
Provide quick, efficient, and reliable services for all Government related jobs such as Employment Permits, Entry Visas, Medical Examinations, miscellaneous jobs related to Immigration, Ministry of Labor & Consulates, and Business Licences to the company and its group , adhering to the regular amendments in rules and regulations within very short notices.
Respond effectively to the demands of the Businesses, employees and their families to assist them on all government related services.
Responsible to administer the following towards Employee and Dependants liaising with local UAE govt ministries :-
a) Obtain new employment visas / work permits for all expatriate employees.
b) Monitor and renew employee residence permits.
c) Obtain new residence visas for dependants of employees.
d) Facilitate renewal of residence visas for dependants.
e) Facilitate obtaining and renewal of Expatriates passports for employees and dependants.
f) Facilitate and follow-up cancellation of visas for employees and dependants.
g) Facilitate complex medical / police procedures on event of death of any employee or next to kin.
Responsible to administer the following towards business facilitation on day-to-day basis:
a) Liaise with embassies / foreign diplomatic missions to enable business visits.
b) Liaise with UAE Immigration dept. in obtaining business entry visas for global business visitors.
Administer company and joint venture companies’ licenses and tax remittances with various UAE
govt. authorities viz., Economic Department, Municipality, Chamber of Commerce and Ministry of Finance & Industries etc.
Provide expert advice to business and employees on all visa formalities and all other gov’t related procedures.
Accountable in maintaining accurate records for all above services.
The ever-changing government rules and regulations requires the post-holder to be abreast of updates on information / documents and at times certain jobs have to be tacked efficiently without much notice.
Any TO-DO-NOW jobs always have to be evaluated, prioritized and accomplished at short notices.
Requirements:
The candidate must have at least 3 years experience in similar job with strong experience with govt. organizations and embassies
Spoken and written English & Arabic is a must
Valid Driving License
Good computer skills (MS Office)

job_description:
We are the market leader in the industry of citizenship programs to legally obtain a second passport. The company holds the strongest credentials within the citizenship by investment industry and it is officially authorized and licensed by international Governments for citizenship processing. Being one of the oldest companies in the industry, during our long journey, we have successfully processed a second nationality for thousands of clients from over 60 countries across Middle East, Africa, Europe and Asia.
We want to expand our network of offices and increase our international presence as well as diversify into new related business areas.
We are looking for an enthusiastic Arabic and English-speaking person as an Office receptionist and Administrative. The main role is to greet visitors and delivering exceptional customer service assistance. Polite and with good manners. Used to deal with HNWI’s.

A Medical Coder, or Certified Professional Coder, is responsible for reviewing a patient’s medical records after a visit and translating the information into codes that insurers use to process claims from patients. Their duties include confirming treatments with medical staff, identifying missing information and submitting forms to insurers for reimbursement.
Medical Coder duties and responsibilities
The duties and responsibilities of a Medical Coder vary from one healthcare facility to another. The main duty of a Medical Coder is to assign codes to medical procedures and diagnoses. Other duties and responsibilities of a Medical Coder include:
Making sure that codes are assigned correctly and sequenced appropriately as per government and insurance regulations
Complying with medical coding guidelines and policies
Receiving and reviewing patients’ charts and documents for verification and accuracy
Following up and clarifying any information that is not clear to other staff members
Collecting information made by the Physician from different sources to prepare monthly reports
Implementing strategic procedures and choosing strategies and evaluation methods that provide correct results
Examining any medical malpractice that has been reported by analyzing and identifying the medical procedures, diagnoses, or events that lead to the negligence
Note: Immediate Joining.

We are looking for a Medical Coder to join our team to assist us in coding for insurance claims and databases. They will also be required to assign American Society Anesthesiologists (ASA), Ambulatory Payment Classifications (APC) or Diagnosis related groups (DRG) codes.Ultimately, you will make decisions on which codes and functions should be assigned in each instance. Ensure all medical records are filed and processed correctly

We are looking for an Early Years Teacher for our Nursery located in Muwailih commercial, Sharjah. We follow the british curriculum EYFS and cater to children from the ages 2 years to 4 years.
The candidate should be fluent in English as we are primarily an English Nursery and should have previous experience in teaching early years students in UAE
Job Summary
− Promote positive relationships in the nursery.
− Promote the health, safety and well being of the children.
− Support the children’s development, learning and play.
− Be a Key Person carrying out all related responsibilities in building relationships with a small group of children and their families.
− Contribute to the effectiveness of teamwork.
− To be a role model and be able to showcase high quality practice with regards to individual and group work with children. − To take responsibility alongside the Nursery Management Team for the safety, security and well-being of all children, staff and visitors at all times.
− To ensure that safeguarding procedures are followed in line with Ministry of Education and nursery’s policies.
− To embrace, understand and promote institution's interest and to understand the role they play as part of the team to provide high levels of care and education.
Responsibilities and Duties
Reflect on daily practice and identify areas for continual improvement.
− To ensure that all children are treated as individuals and are given the required support through nursery’s approach to planning in line with the EYFS.
− To work in partnership to ensure standards are continuously being met in line with Ministry of Education & EYFS framework.
− To ensure that any identified development needs are raised with the Management Team.
− Ensure that settling-in and transitions are well managed for all children, ensuring they are communicated to parents and colleagues.
− To ensure effective communication with staff and families through participation in staff meetings, parent’s evenings and any further events held by the nursery.
− Deal with any parent/carer issues or concerns in a timely manner, escalating any issues to the Nursery Manager as necessary.
− To support the planning and implementation of activities with individual or groups of children; promoting effective teaching and learning
To follow the guidance and requirements as set out in the EYFS.
− To use professional knowledge of the individual and diverse ways that children learn and develop to meet their differing needs.
− To establish positive and sensitive relationships with children.
− To act as a role model and set achievable expectations.
− To promote the inclusion of all children.
− To meet the physical needs of children by encouraging good standards of personal hygiene, whilst promoting independence.
− To provide support for the children’s emotional and social needs by implementing the principles for promoting positive behavior and role modeling high standards in all aspects of their role and personal conduct.
− Participate in the Key Person’s system and be responsible for a group of children including monitoring, assessing, recording and reporting on their development and progress.
− Ensuring that key children’s files are up to date.
− Have a child-centered approach to the running of the service.
− Observe and plan appropriately for the children.
− Practice positive behavior management techniques.
− Ensuring the health and safety of children and staff is maintained during all activities

Triage Nurse (Registered Nurse) – Unique Opportunity for Accelerated Career Progression - South Western Ambulance Service (SWAST) – NHS Devon, UK
We are the Devon Alliance for International Recruitment and we are part of NHS. We are delighted to work alongside South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust (SWAST) to recruit Registered Nurses to join their Emergency Operation Centres as a Triage Nurse based in their Emergency Operation Centre in Exeter, Devon in the beautiful south west of England, UK.
Unique Opportunity – Triage Nurse (Registered Nurse)
We are recruiting Registered Nurses to join SWAST’s Emergency Operation Centres as a ‘Triage Nurse’. As a Triage Nurse, you will be responsible for providing clinical advice and guidance to colleagues, patients and service users via telephone triage to establish appropriate care pathways.
This role is part of a wider team of clinical professionals, including Doctors, Paramedics and Specialist Practitioners. You will provide remote clinical support via telephone, and support decision making with emergency ambulance crews who are on the scene with patients.
Progression opportunity:
Upon obtaining your NMC UK PIN you will progress into a Band 6 Triage Nurse £33,706 to £40,588pa (rather than a Band 5 general Registered Nurse) with the scope to progress to a Band 7 Senior Nurse £41,659 to £47,672 pa within 12 to 24 months. This is a rare and unique opportunity for international Nurses to join South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust at this exciting time. The South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust has also committed to a 5-year employment visa for the successful candidate, with the option to apply for permanent residency after the initial 5-year term.
Interview and required work experience:
The right candidate will have IELTS at level 7.0 or OET at a B, be confident in communicating using the telephone, and have a minimum of 2 years’ experience in a critical or emergency care setting. All Registered Nurses must also register with the UK’s Nursing and Midwifery Council (NMC):
For an insight into the day in the life of a Triage Nurse, please follow this link to see a short video; Join Us, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=io4DnDAN9BQ
SWAST – Exeter, Devon UK
The South Western Ambulance Service (SWAST) is responsible for providing ambulance services for the National Health Service across South West England. SWAST responds to medical emergencies at all times of the day and night, operating a 24-hour clinical response to urgent ‘999’ calls to ensure patients receive the right care as quickly as possible – wherever and whenever they need it!
SWAST’s Emergency Operation Centre, where you will be working, is located in the city of Exeter. Exeter is situated on the River Exe and is a small, historic city which is full of character and has a great cultural scene. Exeter is the capital city of Devon and provides the county with a central base for education, medicine, religion, commerce and culture. It has an array of historic architecture, including Roman ruins, the historical Guildhall and most notably the Cathedral, St Peter's Cathedral which dates back to the 12th century and sits at the heart of the city, dominating the skyline.
Our generous offer includes:
· Sponsorship and paid visa
· Paid flight to the UK
· Band 6 salary (£33,706 to £40,588pa), on receipt of NMC PIN
· 2 months free accommodation (single person accommodation) is provided
· Airport transfers, food vouchers, phone card and bank account
· Free accommodation for two months
· NMC registration and IELTS/OET fees reimbursed
· Full pastoral package
· Free healthcare and schooling
· Opportunities for career development
· Eligibility to apply for family visa
· And much more!
We will hold virtual interviews in 2023 over MS Teams - we hope to meet you then!
www.devon-alliance.com
NB: We adhere to the World Health Organisation's guidelines on ethical recruitment. If you are in one of the 47 countries which is on the 'Red' or 'Amber' list, we are truly sorry but we cannot accept your application.

Salary: AED149,774.76 - AED180,355.36 per year

Virtual Interviews
Experience:
Nursing in an Emergency setting: 2 years (Required)
License/Certification:
Nursing License (Required)
IELTS at 7.0 or OET at B (Required)

Triage Nurse (Registered Nurse) – Unique Opportunity for Accelerated Career Progression - South Western Ambulance Service (SWAST) – NHS Devon, UK
We are the Devon Alliance for International Recruitment and we are part of NHS. We are delighted to work alongside South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust (SWAST) to recruit Registered Nurses to join their Emergency Operation Centres as a Triage Nurse based in their Emergency Operation Centre in Exeter, Devon in the beautiful south west of England, UK.
Unique Opportunity – Triage Nurse (Registered Nurse)
We are recruiting Registered Nurses to join SWAST’s Emergency Operation Centres as a ‘Triage Nurse’. As a Triage Nurse, you will be responsible for providing clinical advice and guidance to colleagues, patients and service users via telephone triage to establish appropriate care pathways.
This role is part of a wider team of clinical professionals, including Doctors, Paramedics and Specialist Practitioners. You will provide remote clinical support via telephone, and support decision making with emergency ambulance crews who are on the scene with patients.
Progression opportunity:
Upon obtaining your NMC UK PIN you will progress into a Band 6 Triage Nurse £33,706 to £40,588pa (rather than a Band 5 general Registered Nurse) with the scope to progress to a Band 7 Senior Nurse £41,659 to £47,672 pa within 12 to 24 months. This is a rare and unique opportunity for international Nurses to join South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust at this exciting time. The South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust has also committed to a 5-year employment visa for the successful candidate, with the option to apply for permanent residency after the initial 5-year term.
Interview and required work experience:
The right candidate will have IELTS at level 7.0 or OET at a B, be confident in communicating using the telephone, and have a minimum of 2 years’ experience in a critical or emergency care setting. All Registered Nurses must also register with the UK’s Nursing and Midwifery Council (NMC):
For an insight into the day in the life of a Triage Nurse, please follow this link to see a short video; Join Us, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=io4DnDAN9BQ
SWAST – Exeter, Devon UK
The South Western Ambulance Service (SWAST) is responsible for providing ambulance services for the National Health Service across South West England. SWAST responds to medical emergencies at all times of the day and night, operating a 24-hour clinical response to urgent ‘999’ calls to ensure patients receive the right care as quickly as possible – wherever and whenever they need it!
SWAST’s Emergency Operation Centre, where you will be working, is located in the city of Exeter. Exeter is situated on the River Exe and is a small, historic city which is full of character and has a great cultural scene. Exeter is the capital city of Devon and provides the county with a central base for education, medicine, religion, commerce and culture. It has an array of historic architecture, including Roman ruins, the historical Guildhall and most notably the Cathedral, St Peter's Cathedral which dates back to the 12th century and sits at the heart of the city, dominating the skyline.
Our generous offer includes:
· Sponsorship and paid visa
· Paid flight to the UK
· Band 6 salary (£33,706 to £40,588pa), on receipt of NMC PIN
· 2 months free accommodation (single person accommodation) is provided
· Airport transfers, food vouchers, phone card and bank account
· Free accommodation for two months
· NMC registration and IELTS/OET fees reimbursed
· Full pastoral package
· Free healthcare and schooling
· Opportunities for career development
· Eligibility to apply for family visa
· And much more!
We will hold virtual interviews in 2023 over MS Teams - we hope to meet you then!
www.devon-alliance.com
NB: We adhere to the World Health Organisation's guidelines on ethical recruitment. If you are in one of the 47 countries which is on the 'Red' or 'Amber' list, we are truly sorry but we cannot accept your application.

Ultimate Stay Vacation Homes Rental is a rapidly growing full-service property management company that connects premium property owners with quality guests from around the world. Our vision is to bridge the gap in luxurious hospitality by providing a trusted and reliable connection between quality guests and property owners. In the heart of what we do, always lies the highest level of service and excellence of Client’s experience. We firmly believe that unforgettable memories are created in unforgettable environments.
The Company's Leadership encompasses top universities graduates (e.g. CBS, CEMS, LBS) and professionals (e.g. Bain, BCG, UBS) that leverage their business, real estate and traveling experience to transform the hospitality industry in Dubai, through excellent customer service (e.g. high ratings, Airbnb SuperHost status), cutting edge technology application (e.g. more advanced solutions than presented in the Museum of the Future) and thought leadership (e.g. perspectives shared in national newspapers).
Ultimate Stay is looking for an enthusiastic, detail and customer experience oriented individual to join our team as Guest Experience & Quality Supervisor, to supervise all our holiday home properties in Dubai. A successful candidate in this role is extremely structured and organized (OCD is very welcome) and has unparalleled attention to detail. The Guest Experience & Quality Supervisor is responsible for continuous improvement of our guests’ experience and reputation of the brand. Ultimately, the candidate must take full responsibility for the guest experience inside the apartment, ensuring that the apartment is perfectly ready to accept even the most demanding guests. All the potential issues must be prevented from occurring in the first place and the guest's stay should be as smooth and comfortable as possible, with an ultimate goal of 10/10 or 5/5 reviews and a returning guest.
The job is ideal for someone who likes being on the move and having frequent face to face interactions, as it will require daily visits to properties and supervision of different cleaning teams.
Tasks & responsibilities
Be the quality guardian for all the company properties to meet 5-star hotel premium standards, proactively and timely identifying any potential and existing issues
Conduct frequent property inspections (holiday homes are located in different buildings and parts of the city) to identify potential guest pain points
Identify areas for improvement based on guests feedback provided by Guests & Reservations Team and develop and implement corresponding initiatives
Provide feedback to the cleaning teams and coach on company best practices and quality standards
Codify all the related know-how (such as property manuals, house rules, checklists, standard operating procedures (SOPs) and emergency procedures)
Monitor and document property conditions (point out issues, create relevant photo and video documentation, etc.)
Manage stock supplies at safe levels (such as extra linen, towels, baby equipment)
When needed, roll up the sleeves and perform housekeeping and maintenance duties
Work on other related occasional tasks as - meet and greet VIP / special assistance guests, personally address difficult late check-out cases, collect cash for offline reservations, etc.
Open to cover for other employees in case of holidays
Ensure all the apartments comply with health and safety regulations
As required, support team in any operations, guest related and onboarding activities
Successful candidate profile
Desire to be a part of a growth story with one of the fastest growing companies in the sector
Excitement to work hand-in-hand with the founding team and receive coaching offered by the Leadership
Leadership skills allowing to create and nurture Guest Experience & Quality Team
Very orderly approach and familiarity with processes, checklists, etc.
Extremely strong attention to detail (stepping into 5-star hotel guest shoes)
High responsiveness and reliability
Strong autonomy in planning and tasks execution (excellent time management skills)
Ability to work well under pressure in an agile, fast-paced environment
Ability to change activity frequently and multitask
Guest-first approach
Exceptional interpersonal skills
Professionalism in all forms of communications such as reports, emails, phone calls and texts
Experience in writing and adhering to manuals, checklists, standard operating procedures (SOPs), etc.
Technical computer skills required on all forms of hardware (laptops, tablets, mobile devices) and software (shared folders, GSuite, Microsoft Office)
Proficiency in collaborative cloud applications
Adherence to all company policies and procedures
Availability to work 6 days a week
Prior hospitality experience is a must, preferably in a 5-star hotel
Accommodation in central location of Dubai is a must
Driving license valid in the UAE is a must
English is a must, proficiency in other of the widely spoken languages in the UAE is a plus
Package:
Up to 7,000 AED/month depending on candidate experience and meeting all the job requirements. Financial package consists of base salary, car allowance and guest feedback-based variable remuneration
Company SIM and laptop
Vacation days package and annual return flight home
Insurance
Discretionary performance based bonuses

FINANCE OFFICER
Main duties & Responsibilities:
The Finance Officer will be responsible for organizing day-to-day accounting of the company’s operations and providing effective support in financial management of the company overall, including tax filing and procuring annual audit in accordance with company policy and procedures and appliable regulations in the UAE. The Finance Officer will be responsible for the following tasks:
Standard management of company accounts and finances, using credible accounting software (Quickbooks) consistent with IFRS standards
Create, manage, and maintain book-keeping of daily transactions
Prepare regular financial reports, including monthly financial statements, cashflow reports, P&L and balance sheets, taking responsibility for accuracy of all financial data
Keeping track of bank correspondence and producing bank reconciliation of company accounts
Issuing invoices for clients, interacting with sales and procurement teams and relevant team of the Client
Assisting in preparing sales quotations, including price calculations
Manage an effective and transparent petty cash system
Prepare and manage company payroll on a monthly basis, including maintaing the wages protection system (WPS) for monthly payrolls
Procure and assist with annual and ad-hoc audits
Supporting effective inventory management in collaboration with Warehouse/Logistics team
Introduction and application of internal control measures
Assist with development of budgets and ensuring budget implementation
Management of the company’s cashflow effectively in accordance with plan and budget
Prepare and execute VAT filing or any other taxes
Prepare paperwork for customs clearance or any other tax clearance of imported goods
Keep records of company finances in an effective filing system
Policy, regulations, plan development: Financial management policy, procurement policy; payment and credit policy; petty cash handling
Any other task may be assigned by the Line-Manager.

At least have 3 years of proven work experience in Finance field
Bachelor’s degree in finance related field (Business Administration, Commerce, Accounting) or another relevant field.
Excellent knowledge of accounting and book keeping.
Should have Advance knowledge of Quickbooks software.
Good knowledge of MS Office
Excellent knowledge of English language both oral and written.
Skills:

High integrity to be able to handle cash and cash related transactions

Attention to detail to be able to scrutinize financial and other information documents before decision making
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to uphold and respect work ethics and conduct activities with integrity
Be a good team player endowed with patience, flexibility and honesty
Flexible in working hours and early morning shift

Executive housekeeper is responsible for ensuring the operation of the housekeeping and laundry department in an attentive, friendly, efficient and courteous manner, providing all guests with quality service and a clean and safe environment throughout their stay.
MAIN DUTIES
Operations
1. Supervises housekeeping operations such as cleaning and maintenance whilst ensuring compliance with all housekeeping policies, procedures, standards and satisfaction of guests’ needs.
2. To be responsible for managing the housekeeping department in order to ensure the highest standards of cleanliness of the hotel including guest rooms, public areas, food & beverage outlets, banquet facilities and back of house in accordance with corporate quality standards.
3. Develops implements and continually reviews the policies, procedures, practices and standards.
4. Manages linen inventory and guest supplies and the ordering of supplies as necessary to meet quality standards and hotel business needs.
5. Coordinates and reviews contracts, including plants rental, cleaning contracts, flowers and ensures compliance by both parties.
6. Participates in the planning of hotel decoration for special functions and festive seasons and organizes the necessary actions.
7. Keeps information on all new equipments and cleaning products and evaluates their quality, maintains knowledge of local competition and housekeeping industry trends.
Finance
1. Prepares the annual Housekeeping budget and yearly manpower forecast for the department.
Team Management
1. Maximizes employee productivity and morale within the department and consistently maintains discipline within hotel guidelines and local regulations.
2. Schedules employees in line with varying business levels in order to maximize productivity and minimize payroll costs.
3. Selects and recruits suitable employees for the department using prescribed set of policies and procedures.
4. Give appropriate skills training to team members in order to meet guests’ needs and maintain standards.
5. Identifies employees with potential for promotion and/or transfer and makes appropriate development plans for him/her together with the General Manager.
6. Conducts monthly departmental meetings with staff in order to review the monthly achievements and areas for development.
7. Establishes and maintains effective internal communications including daily meetings with staff to ensure optimum team work and productivity.
Health & Safety
1 Understands and strictly adheres to the Rules & Regulations established in regards to hotel’s policy on Fire, Hygiene and Health & Safety.
2 Ensures that all potential and real hazards are reported and reduced immediately.
3 Adheres to the hotel’s fire and emergency threat procedures.
4 Practices and enforces all emergency procedures to provide the security and safety of guests and employees.
5 Ensures that all employees have a complete understanding of and adhere to the Hotel’s Employee rules and regulations.
Fundamentals
1 Work within all pre-set budgetary limits.
2 Comply with all systems and procedures as laid down by the General Manager.
3 To be able to perform any additional scope of duties if requested by the Management.
To attend the mandatory External and Internal training and follow the company training policy.

Triage Nurse (Registered Nurse) – Unique Opportunity for Accelerated Career Progression - South Western Ambulance Service (SWAST) – NHS Devon, UK
We are the Devon Alliance for International Recruitment and we are part of NHS. We are delighted to work alongside South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust (SWAST) to recruit Registered Nurses to join their Emergency Operation Centres as a Triage Nurse based in their Emergency Operation Centre in Exeter, Devon in the beautiful south west of England, UK.
Unique Opportunity – Triage Nurse (Registered Nurse)
We are recruiting Registered Nurses to join SWAST’s Emergency Operation Centres as a ‘Triage Nurse’. As a Triage Nurse, you will be responsible for providing clinical advice and guidance to colleagues, patients and service users via telephone triage to establish appropriate care pathways.
This role is part of a wider team of clinical professionals, including Doctors, Paramedics and Specialist Practitioners. You will provide remote clinical support via telephone, and support decision making with emergency ambulance crews who are on the scene with patients.
Progression opportunity:
Upon obtaining your NMC UK PIN you will progress into a Band 6 Triage Nurse £33,706 to £40,588pa (rather than a Band 5 general Registered Nurse) with the scope to progress to a Band 7 Senior Nurse £41,659 to £47,672 pa within 12 to 24 months. This is a rare and unique opportunity for international Nurses to join South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust at this exciting time. The South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust has also committed to a 5-year employment visa for the successful candidate, with the option to apply for permanent residency after the initial 5-year term.
Interview and required work experience:
The right candidate will have IELTS at level 7.0 or OET at a B, be confident in communicating using the telephone, and have a minimum of 2 years’ experience in a critical or emergency care setting. All Registered Nurses must also register with the UK’s Nursing and Midwifery Council (NMC):
For an insight into the day in the life of a Triage Nurse, please follow this link to see a short video; Join Us, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=io4DnDAN9BQ
SWAST – Exeter, Devon UK
The South Western Ambulance Service (SWAST) is responsible for providing ambulance services for the National Health Service across South West England. SWAST responds to medical emergencies at all times of the day and night, operating a 24-hour clinical response to urgent ‘999’ calls to ensure patients receive the right care as quickly as possible – wherever and whenever they need it!
SWAST’s Emergency Operation Centre, where you will be working, is located in the city of Exeter. Exeter is situated on the River Exe and is a small, historic city which is full of character and has a great cultural scene. Exeter is the capital city of Devon and provides the county with a central base for education, medicine, religion, commerce and culture. It has an array of historic architecture, including Roman ruins, the historical Guildhall and most notably the Cathedral, St Peter's Cathedral which dates back to the 12th century and sits at the heart of the city, dominating the skyline.
Our generous offer includes:
· Sponsorship and paid visa
· Paid flight to the UK
· Band 6 salary (£33,706 to £40,588pa), on receipt of NMC PIN
· 2 months free accommodation (single person accommodation) is provided
· Airport transfers, food vouchers, phone card and bank account
· Free accommodation for two months
· NMC registration and IELTS/OET fees reimbursed
· Full pastoral package
· Free healthcare and schooling
· Opportunities for career development
· Eligibility to apply for family visa
· And much more!
We will hold virtual interviews in 2023 over MS Teams - we hope to meet you then!
www.devon-alliance.com
NB: We adhere to the World Health Organisation's guidelines on ethical recruitment. If you are in one of the 47 countries which is on the 'Red' or 'Amber' list, we are truly sorry but we cannot accept your application.

About IIPD - Institute of Innovation and Professional Development
Founded in 2016, IIPD is one of the leading training & consultancy institutes in the region offering innovative training programs in Industrial /Building/ Home Automation, Energy Management, Software & IT and other technical & professional courses. Our mission is to develop people to their fullest potential, bringing difference in their lives and organization they belong to. We deeply understand current and future requirements of our clients to deliver customized and personalised learning. Our diversified training programs and consulting services are devised and delivered by highly competent subject matter experts which sets us apart. Our technical courses are fully practical with real world industry applications. We provide individual attention to each student and make sure they learn satisfactorily leaving happiness and fulfillment.
Job Description
As Training consultant, you will be integral part of the sales team. You are highly energetic with strong passion for sales, closing numbers and over achieving. You love to meet people, discuss their training requirements and help them chose the right training path. You help people grow in their career.

Triage Nurse (Registered Nurse) – Unique Opportunity for Accelerated Career Progression - South Western Ambulance Service (SWAST) – NHS Devon, UK
We are the Devon Alliance for International Recruitment and we are part of NHS. We are delighted to work alongside South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust (SWAST) to recruit Registered Nurses to join their Emergency Operation Centres as a Triage Nurse based in their Emergency Operation Centre in Exeter, Devon in the beautiful south west of England, UK.
Unique Opportunity – Triage Nurse (Registered Nurse)
We are recruiting Registered Nurses to join SWAST’s Emergency Operation Centres as a ‘Triage Nurse’. As a Triage Nurse, you will be responsible for providing clinical advice and guidance to colleagues, patients and service users via telephone triage to establish appropriate care pathways.
This role is part of a wider team of clinical professionals, including Doctors, Paramedics and Specialist Practitioners. You will provide remote clinical support via telephone, and support decision making with emergency ambulance crews who are on the scene with patients.
Progression opportunity:
Upon obtaining your NMC UK PIN you will progress into a Band 6 Triage Nurse £33,706 to £40,588pa (rather than a Band 5 general Registered Nurse) with the scope to progress to a Band 7 Senior Nurse £41,659 to £47,672 pa within 12 to 24 months. This is a rare and unique opportunity for international Nurses to join South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust at this exciting time. The South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust has also committed to a 5-year employment visa for the successful candidate, with the option to apply for permanent residency after the initial 5-year term.
Interview and required work experience:
The right candidate will have IELTS at level 7.0 or OET at a B, be confident in communicating using the telephone, and have a minimum of 2 years’ experience in a critical or emergency care setting. All Registered Nurses must also register with the UK’s Nursing and Midwifery Council (NMC):
For an insight into the day in the life of a Triage Nurse, please follow this link to see a short video; Join Us, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=io4DnDAN9BQ
SWAST – Exeter, Devon UK
The South Western Ambulance Service (SWAST) is responsible for providing ambulance services for the National Health Service across South West England. SWAST responds to medical emergencies at all times of the day and night, operating a 24-hour clinical response to urgent ‘999’ calls to ensure patients receive the right care as quickly as possible – wherever and whenever they need it!
SWAST’s Emergency Operation Centre, where you will be working, is located in the city of Exeter. Exeter is situated on the River Exe and is a small, historic city which is full of character and has a great cultural scene. Exeter is the capital city of Devon and provides the county with a central base for education, medicine, religion, commerce and culture. It has an array of historic architecture, including Roman ruins, the historical Guildhall and most notably the Cathedral, St Peter's Cathedral which dates back to the 12th century and sits at the heart of the city, dominating the skyline.
Our generous offer includes:
· Sponsorship and paid visa
· Paid flight to the UK
· Band 6 salary (£33,706 to £40,588pa), on receipt of NMC PIN
· 2 months free accommodation (single person accommodation) is provided
· Airport transfers, food vouchers, phone card and bank account
· Free accommodation for two months
· NMC registration and IELTS/OET fees reimbursed
· Full pastoral package
· Free healthcare and schooling
· Opportunities for career development
· Eligibility to apply for family visa
· And much more!
We will hold virtual interviews in 2023 over MS Teams - we hope to meet you then!
www.devon-alliance.com
NB: We adhere to the World Health Organisation's guidelines on ethical recruitment. If you are in one of the 47 countries which is on the 'Red' or 'Amber' list, we are truly sorry but we cannot accept your application.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: ﷼153,123.26 - ﷼184,387.55 per year

Virtual Interviews

We are a leading Property Development Group in the UK that is on the verge of disrupting the Over 55’s property market sector.
Why does it need disrupting?
Gone are the days of waiting to get old and move into a care home that is provided for by the government. Sadly, governments today have fiscally bankrupted themselves and have no means or desire to provide for the very ones who contributed immensely to the civilisations they inhabit.
We intend to do something about this that not only answers the immense need (1.5+m retirement homes needed today in the UK, 11.1m people over 55 in the UK as of today) but moreover, do it in such a way that minimises their tax liabilities.
To assist us in executing this vision, we are needing a competent, dynamic, and resourceful Chief Investment Officer (CIO).
We envisage this individual to currently be employed within the investments market, this could stem from promoting stocks, bonds, alternate assets, equities, capital, finance, real estate, lawyers, accountants…
The key dynamic is this individual possessing a significant number of active investors that they have personally done business with before, this is crucial.
And as we live in the most deceitful time in history where everyone proclaims to be anyone they choose to be, without being able to back up their words with works or deeds.
It is mandatory that this individual performs a “Live Test”or “Proof of Performance” test. See, the proof is always in the pudding, the pudding representing the works and if you make the pudding, then the role is yours.
Live Test
To secure funding for GBP £5.5m
Project Overview
Mixed use development comprising 200 apartments (of which 60 are affordable) and commercial buildings
Highline Figures
Acquisition & All Consultants and Contractors Costs: £7,618,230
Construction Costs: £58,612,400
Total Costs: £66,230,630
Net Revenue: £93,327,000
Profit Before Funding: £27,096,370
Property Valuation as it stands today (Pre-Application completed) £2m to £2.5m
Once Outline Planning Approved £8m to £10m
The £5.5m funding must be secured entirely from your own resources and abilities on a standalone basis. There will be no financials or resources provided for this test by us, no A&L’s nothing. As this would totally negate the purpose and intent of this test.
Moreover, anyone with an existing network of HNW investors or equity partners should easily be able to secure these funds within 30/45days maximum.
Can you do this?
If so, we will guarantee you upfront that you will be given this position, so no further requirements needed by you to obtain this position, nothing...
Remuneration & Reward
· Monthly Fee
· Commission
· Profit Share
· Private Health Insurance
· Own office within a new local accountancy practice
· Marketing and resources provided after completing “Live Test”
· Financial Independence for life
· Be part of something greater than you could do alone
· Help a market sector that is in desperate need of help
All the above is only after you complete the “Live Test” so, this is crystal clear, we will provide you with nothing apart from more details on the project described above, with this information you must go directly to your HNW network and raise the GBP £5.5m within 30/45 days maximum.
Can you do this?
If so, apply for this position knowing with certainty that you are going to be given this role.

job_title: RECRUITING SCHOOL COUNSELORS AND SEN CO-ORDINATOR
job_description:
Role Summary
Looking for a dedicated, enthusiastic, committed, and dynamic school counselor and SEN co-ordinator to join the department at School.
About SSIS
Shining Star International School is a high performing International School in Abu Dhabi, fully accredited with CBSE- the largest examination conducting entity in the world..
Our students receive a sound and holistic education across a wide range of subjects and extra-curricular activities, which helps them to develop and hone a broad range of skills.
Shining Star International School is all inclusive private school established in 2014 in Musaffah, Abu Dhabi. Currently serving the needs of the local and international expatriate community it follows the CBSE curriculum and its students are encouraged to embark on a voyage of discovery that uncovers hidden talents in their niche areas of interest.
As they grow our ‘Shining Stars’ become beacons of light within their own peer groups and are taught how to use the knowledge and wisdom gained during their time in the school to benefit the people they associate with and the world at large.
Key Work Responsibilities
· Implement instructional activities that contribute to a climate where students are actively engaged in meaningful learning experiences.
· Inform students of disciplinary rules set by the School and personally make sure that any misconduct is handled appropriately.
· Ensure proper maintenance of school properties. Take full responsibility for damages, if any, in their class room property and report the cause of damage of the facility immediately or else take the responsibility to replace or fix the damage.
· Identify, select and modify instructional resources to meet the needs of the students with varying backgrounds, learning styles, and special needs.
· Maintain effective and efficient record keeping procedures.
· Provide a positive environment in which students are encouraged to be actively engaged in the learning process.
· Ensure the note books and assessment papers are corrected and recorded for performance tracking, progress recording and for future reference.
· Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with students, parents and other professionals on a regular basis.
· Collaborate with colleagues to enhance the instructional environment, establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with students, parents and the school.
· Model professional and ethical standards when dealing with students, parents, colleagues and community.
· Assume responsibility for meeting their course and school-wide students’ performance goals.
· Demonstrate progress in student performance.
· Participate in training and presentations on online teaching.
· Meet professional obligations through efficient work habits such as: meeting deadlines, honoring schedules and coordinating.
· Participate in extracurricular activities such as social activities, sporting activities, House and student organizations.
· Participate in department and school meetings, parent meetings.
· Keep updated with developments in subject area, teaching resources and methods and make relevant changes to instructional plans and activities.
· Identify and select different instructional resources and methods to meet students' varying needs.
· Understand that responsibilities are subject to having performance goals and targets established as part of the annual performance planning process or as the result of organizational planning.
· Prepares and moderates question papers for school examinations.
· Upload Lesson Plans-weekly plans, Mid Term Plans, Yearly plans, worksheets, School academic calendar, events and activity calendar ,Circulars and notices in the school ERP portal( Eth –DC)
· Perform other responsibilities which may be assigned by the school authorities from time to time.
· Responsible for Academic excellence of students.
· Collaborates with peers for the purpose of implementing and maintaining curricular and co-curricular programs for students and personal development
· Participates in peer observation and performance tracking.
Benefits
Excellent Remuneration Package, Competitive tax-free salary, 50% of on child education, private medical insurance, end of Service Gratuity, paid holidays.

Triage Nurse (Registered Nurse) – Unique Opportunity for Accelerated Career Progression - South Western Ambulance Service (SWAST) – NHS Devon, UK
We are the Devon Alliance for International Recruitment and we are part of NHS. We are delighted to work alongside South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust (SWAST) to recruit Registered Nurses to join their Emergency Operation Centres as a Triage Nurse based in their Emergency Operation Centre in Exeter, Devon in the beautiful south west of England, UK.
Unique Opportunity – Triage Nurse (Registered Nurse)
We are recruiting Registered Nurses to join SWAST’s Emergency Operation Centres as a ‘Triage Nurse’. As a Triage Nurse, you will be responsible for providing clinical advice and guidance to colleagues, patients and service users via telephone triage to establish appropriate care pathways.
This role is part of a wider team of clinical professionals, including Doctors, Paramedics and Specialist Practitioners. You will provide remote clinical support via telephone, and support decision making with emergency ambulance crews who are on the scene with patients.
Progression opportunity:
Upon obtaining your NMC UK PIN you will progress into a Band 6 Triage Nurse £33,706 to £40,588pa (rather than a Band 5 general Registered Nurse) with the scope to progress to a Band 7 Senior Nurse £41,659 to £47,672 pa within 12 to 24 months. This is a rare and unique opportunity for international Nurses to join South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust at this exciting time. The South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust has also committed to a 5-year employment visa for the successful candidate, with the option to apply for permanent residency after the initial 5-year term.
Interview and required work experience:
The right candidate will have IELTS at level 7.0 or OET at a B, be confident in communicating using the telephone, and have a minimum of 2 years’ experience in a critical or emergency care setting. All Registered Nurses must also register with the UK’s Nursing and Midwifery Council (NMC):
For an insight into the day in the life of a Triage Nurse, please follow this link to see a short video; Join Us, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=io4DnDAN9BQ
SWAST – Exeter, Devon UK
The South Western Ambulance Service (SWAST) is responsible for providing ambulance services for the National Health Service across South West England. SWAST responds to medical emergencies at all times of the day and night, operating a 24-hour clinical response to urgent ‘999’ calls to ensure patients receive the right care as quickly as possible – wherever and whenever they need it!
SWAST’s Emergency Operation Centre, where you will be working, is located in the city of Exeter. Exeter is situated on the River Exe and is a small, historic city which is full of character and has a great cultural scene. Exeter is the capital city of Devon and provides the county with a central base for education, medicine, religion, commerce and culture. It has an array of historic architecture, including Roman ruins, the historical Guildhall and most notably the Cathedral, St Peter's Cathedral which dates back to the 12th century and sits at the heart of the city, dominating the skyline.
Our generous offer includes:
· Sponsorship and paid visa
· Paid flight to the UK
· Band 6 salary (£33,706 to £40,588pa), on receipt of NMC PIN
· 2 months free accommodation (single person accommodation) is provided
· Airport transfers, food vouchers, phone card and bank account
· Free accommodation for two months
· NMC registration and IELTS/OET fees reimbursed
· Full pastoral package
· Free healthcare and schooling
· Opportunities for career development
· Eligibility to apply for family visa
· And much more!
We will hold virtual interviews in 2023 over MS Teams - we hope to meet you then!
www.devon-alliance.com
NB: We adhere to the World Health Organisation's guidelines on ethical recruitment. If you are in one of the 47 countries which is on the 'Red' or 'Amber' list, we are truly sorry but we cannot accept your application.
