JOB SUMMARY
Mid-management position that focuses on successfully accomplishing the daily objectives in the kitchen. Assists in leading staff while personally assisting in all areas of the kitchen, including food production, purchasing, and kitchen sanitation. Position contributes to ensuring guests and employees’ satisfaction while maintaining the operating budget.
CANDIDATE PROFILE
· Degree / Diploma in Culinary Arts from an accredited university
· Minimum 4 years’ experience in Kitchen Operations including procedures and functions, food planning, purchasing, sanitation, security, company policies and procedures, personnel management, record keeping and preparation of reports and in a leadership role
· Good communication skills. Must be able to speak, read and write English. Additional languages will be preferred
· Must be able to handle the pressures of a busy kitchen, guest demands, simultaneously coordinate a wide range of activities and recommend appropriate solutions to restaurant problems
· Able to work in a standing position for long periods of time, multi task and work in a fast paced environment
CORE WORK ACTIVITIES
· To assist in ensuring that the outlet is managed successfully as an independent profit center.
· To maintain control and discipline, providing direction and assuming all consequent duties and responsibilities.
· To assist in performance appraisals when necessary.
· To monitor all costs and recommend measures to control them and establish an integrated cost management plan.
· To ensure that the Department Operational Budget is strictly adhered to.
· To review monthly forecasts and schedule resources accordingly.
· To ensure that the outlet is managed efficiently according to the established concept statements and adhere to company policies & procedures and all standards.
· To assist in the implementation of flexible allocation of employees based on established business productivity.
· To assign responsibilities to subordinates and to check their performance periodically.
· To support staff needs in other Divisions based on the priorities and anticipated business levels.
· To take corrective action when and where necessary.
· To establish, implement and control performance standards for the Stewarding Operation.
· Ensures that all food preparation and presentation and kitchen sanitation practices meet with company standards and local legislations.
· To ensure the implementation and monitoring of the various food safety and hygiene standards including HACCP and other Municipality regulations.
· To be available in the outlet (during peak periods) to ensure that the outlet is managed well by the respective Outlet team and functions to the fullest expectations.
· To be demanding and critical when it comes to service standards.
· To ensure that each of his respective team projects a warm, professional, and welcoming image.
· To handle guest and employee inquiries in a courteous and efficient manner and report guest complaints or problems to direct report if no immediate solution can be found and assure to follow up with guests.
· To establish a rapport with guests maintaining good customer relationship and handle all guest complaints, requests and inquiries on food, beverage and service.
· To frequently verify that only “fresh” products are used in Food & Beverage preparation.
· To encourage creativity among his team.
· To continuously seek ways to assist in maximizing the restaurant’s revenues and profits.
· To ensure that employee food is as good and well maintained as a restaurant outlet.
· To ensure that all Departmental Operations Manuals are prepared and updated as necessary.
· To ensure that all Kitchen forms and reports are forwarded in timely manner.
· To ensure accurate maintenance of recipes, conversion recipes, yield tables and product specifications.
· To ensure that all recipes are followed strictly in order to achieve consistency of product and service.
· To keep Service employees up to date with seasonally available products and new products on the market.
· To organize, attend, and ensure that all department meetings are well planned, efficient and result oriented.
· To conduct daily operations briefing with the Executive Chef and Restaurant Manager
· To ensure that deadlines on all projects are met.
· To prepare weekly work schedules in accordance with workload and priorities.
· To ensure the smooth operation of the Kitchen Department.
· To conduct yearly performance appraisal and give employees regular feedback on their job performance.
· Must be an example of The Surf Café/Leen’s Values, Brand Standards, and a champion of appearance and hygiene guidelines.
· Implement guidelines, policies and procedures for those operating departments according to The Surf Café/Leen’s Guidelines & Standards.

At Iron Mountain we protect what our customers value most, from the everyday to the extraordinary. We build customer value around the world with a passion for preserving the physical, transforming the digital, and respecting the environmental. We pioneered the industry for global records and information management and have established some of the best customer relationships in the industry with 95% of the Fortune 1000 companies among our 225,000 loyal customers. Here, you’ll bring your expertise and creativity to a workplace that thrives on continuous improvement. Here, you’ll be part of a global workforce that embraces the differences among us. And here, we’ll encourage you to Climb Higher for the benefit of our customers and each other. There is so much more, but enough about us. We can’t wait to hear about YOU.
About the opportunity
The Credit Collections Specialist is a key member of the A2C team and strongly oriented Cash Collection/Collection process enhancement and continuous improvement.The main focus of this role is to drive a cash mindset with a sense of urgency on Top Accounts and identifying areas of continuous improvement with the billing team, sales, operations and commercial.
You'll Get
Create customer account collection analysis, Aging Reports
Contact customers, via phone and e-mail, regarding their open invoices and billing disputes.
Identify issues causing delay in payment
Achieve set collection plans by completing customers’ visits.
Reduce overdue amounts by strategic actions and standard collection actions
To follow up reconciliation of the customers ( monthly, quarterly and yearly)
Create Bad-Debt and Credit Memo Reports for your portfolio
Independently manage a portfolio of accounts on a month over month basis to minimize the overall delinquency rate to achieve target results set by Management
Ensure customers received all issued invoices.
Verify customers’ accounts balance with company’s balances to ensure proper reconciliation.
Provide daily updates to ensure proper collections.
Ensure receipt voucher is kept safe at all times and handed over to cashier when voucher is full.
Ensure depositing the daily cash collections to the cashier.
Escalate collection issues to Manager
Monitor and report monthly KPIs
Be part of the Project Team involved in the implementation
Clearly communicate analysis and recommendations to leadership
Perform Collections Department projects as directed by management.
Cash application if required.
What You Will Bring
Ability to read, analyze and interpret numerical data.
Strong attention to detail, rigorous.
Ability to communicate key messages, both verbal and written, clearly across a diverse range of contacts.
At least intermediate level of English, both oral and written ideally Arabic speaking and written
Understanding of the importance of cash within a business, and understanding of the components that can drive improvement results in cash collection metrics to a targeted level.
Track record of successfully meeting cash collections. Strong business process definition and analysis skills.
Strong analysis, problem solving, proactive root cause analysis, customer interfacing and conflict resolution skills.
Ability to assess risk with A2C processes and to implement appropriate controls to mitigate risk.
Driving cash collection to meet targets for A2C as well as embedding a cash mindset in all activities and regional partners.
Collaborate cross-functional (Billing Team, Sales, Operations, Finance) to drive the eradication of the root causes of the most frequently occurring customer issues or disputes, ensuring that action plans are documented and executed on time.
Providing guidance and advice on how to resolve major customer payment issues, e.g. reviewing accounts with significant aged backlogs of unpaid invoices, unresolved disputes and unallocated cash.
This will include leading meetings with major customers to discuss issues and agree resolution plans.
Managing the implementation and ongoing execution of leading practice cash collection processes including proactive telephone collection, variable automated dunning letter cycles, etc. This will include reviewing results on a monthly basis and making adjustments as and when required.
Your Qualifications:
Bachelor in accounting, finance, banking, business, or a similar field.
2-4 years' experience as a credit officer.
Outstanding analytical capability with attention to detail
Ability to clearly deliver executive-level communications
Advanced user of MS Excel/ Google Sheet (including pivot tables and data manipulation)
Very good knowledge of Cash collection and Billing process
End to end process understanding of the A2C operating model, ideally with a track record of DSO and cash collection sustainable performance improvement.
Experience working in a multinational environment in a matrix management structure.
AR settlement negotiations with largest customers and senior individuals
Willingness to learn
Thrive as a team player in a fast paced environment
Detail-oriented
Problem-solving skills which require exercising independent judgment
Excellent organizational skills and the ability to work well under pressure.
Strong ethical behavior and the ability to work with sensitive financial information.
What's In It For You
Be part of an ever-evolving global organization focused on transformation and innovation
A support system where you have a safe place to voice your opinion, share feedback, and be your true authentic self
Competitive Total Reward offerings to support your career at Iron Mountain, family, personal wellness, financial wellbeing, and retirement
Our clients come from all walks of life, and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm, bring your best self to work. We insist!

About SABIS®:
SABIS® is a global education network that has an active presence in 20 countries on five continents. Schools in the SABIS® Network educate over 70,000 students and implement a proven, proprietary system. SABIS® Network schools provide students with a top-quality education that prepares them to meet the challenges of a changing world.
SABIS® and SABIS® Network schools employ over 8,000 employees worldwide.
For more information about the SABIS® Network, visit: www.sabis.net.
Job Purpose:
Perform a variety of accounting activities for the preparation of reliable and timely financial statements. Make sure all accounting work is performed according to generally accepted accounting principles, established procedures, departmental guidelines, and applicable regulatory requirements.
Key Responsibilities:
Assisting in maintaining accuracy of general, revenue, expenditure, and subsidiary ledgers.
Conducting verification and reconciliation tasks for banks, associated SABIS® Network schools, and SABIS® group entities, as well as researching and resolving discrepancies.
Reviewing and auditing accounts receivable, receipts, cash payments, and other accounting records and transactions, as well as ensuring money is posted to correct accounts and that all related accounts balance.
Recording entries in the accounting system including, receipts, debit/credit notes payments, invoices and other journals as approved by the financial controller.
Following up and monitoring collections from parents, and reporting on outstanding collections as required.
Ensuring timely month-end closing of students’ accounts and supplier statements and issuance of reliable and accurate financial reports.
Preparing and reviewing essential financial documentation regarding declarations and payments to comply with the governing financial rules and regulations of the country.
Assisting in the development of the annual budget.
Participating in the year-end audit by compiling and preparing supporting schedules, work papers, and financial reports as requested by the financial controller.
Coordinating with, and reporting to the Financial Controller on the implementation and maintenance of effective internal control systems to safeguard school assets and prevent fraud.
Ensuring collections from parents are processed through the banking system, not in cash and reporting all discrepancies to the financial controller.
Performing other related tasks or projects as they arise and/or as delegated by the financial controller and the SABIS® Representative
Ideal Requirements:
Bachelor degree in a related subject matter and/or equivalent
English Proficient
Minimum of 4-6 years of experience in the field
Professional Behavior and Ethical Conduct
Communication skills
Ability to work within a team
Employment Requirements:
Must meet all employment requirements including, but not limited to, country and local education and certification requirements, reference checks, and criminal background checks.
Additional details about this position will only be provided to short-listed candidates.
SABIS® is an equal opportunity employer. We are dedicated to a policy of non – discrimination in employment on any basis including age, sex, color, race, creed, national origin, religion, marital status, disability or any other legally protected characteristics.

we are passionate about solar energy and everything it has to offer you as well as the planet. It’s our mission to offer a sustainable source of energy to homeowners across the U.S. Since 2007, we have established ourselves as one of the leading providers of rooftop solar energy systems in the U.S.

We are a leading Property Development Group in the UK that is on the verge of disrupting the Over 55’s property market sector.
Why does it need disrupting?
Gone are the days of waiting to get old and move into a care home that is provided for by the government. Sadly, governments today have fiscally bankrupted themselves and have no means or desire to provide for the very ones who contributed immensely to the civilisations they inhabit.
We intend to do something about this that not only answers the immense need (1.5+m retirement homes needed today in the UK, 11.1m people over 55 in the UK as of today) but moreover, do it in such a way that minimises their tax liabilities.
To assist us in executing this vision, we are needing a competent, dynamic, and resourceful Chief Investment Officer (CIO).
We envisage this individual to currently be employed within the investments market, this could stem from promoting stocks, bonds, alternate assets, equities, capital, finance, real estate, lawyers, accountants…
The key dynamic is this individual possessing a significant number of active investors that they have personally done business with before, this is crucial.
And as we live in the most deceitful time in historywhere everyone proclaims to be anyone they choose to be, without being able to back up their words with works or deeds.
It is mandatory that this individual performs a “Live Test”or “Proof of Performance” test. See, the proof is always in the pudding, the pudding representing the works and if you make the pudding, then the role is yours.
Live Test
To secure funding for GBP £5.5m
Project Overview
Mixed use development comprising 200 apartments (of which 60 are affordable) and commercial buildings
Highline Figures
Acquisition & All Consultants and Contractors Costs: £7,618,230
Construction Costs: £58,612,400
Total Costs: £66,230,630
Net Revenue: £93,327,000
Profit Before Funding: £27,096,370
Property Valuation as it stands today (Pre-Application completed) £2m to £2.5m
Once Outline Planning Approved £8m to £10m
The £5.5m funding must be secured entirely from your own resources and abilities on a standalone basis. There will be no financials or resources provided for this test by us, no A&L’s nothing. As this would totally negate the purpose and intent of this test.
Moreover, anyone with an existing network of HNW investors or equity partners should easily be able to secure these funds within 30/45days maximum.
Can you do this?
If so, we will guarantee you upfront that you will be given this position, so no further requirements needed by you to obtain this position, nothing...
Remuneration & Reward
· Monthly Fee
· Commission
· Profit Share
· Private Health Insurance
· Own office within a new local accountancy practice
· Marketing and resources provided after completing “Live Test”
· Financial Independence for life
· Be part of something greater than you could do alone
· Help a market sector that is in desperate need of help
All the above is only after you complete the “Live Test” so, this is crystal clear, we will provide you with nothing apart from more details on the project described above, with this information you must go directly to your HNW network and raise the GBP £5.5m within 30/45 days maximum.
Can you do this?
If so, apply for this position knowing with certainty that you are going to be given this role.

Under the general direction of the Group Chief Financial Officer and Group Financial Controller the Finance Manager has to ensure the accuracy and authenticity of all accounting transactions as per the IFRS guidelines, manage various accounting functions such as maintaining the books of accounts, supervising accounting staff; assisting the preparation of the annual budget; in charge of timely closing of accounts for quarterly review as well as annual financial audit as per the deadlines; control on record keeping/documents filing, taking care of Zakat, VAT, Withholding Tax, Customs Duty Drawback computation & and obtaining the certificates, keeping track of intercompany transactions, monitor related party transactions, ensure timely collection from debtors.
Major Duties and Responsibilities
► Obtain and maintain a thorough understanding of the financial reporting and general ledger structure.
► Ensure the accuracy and authenticity of all accounting transactions as per the IFRS guidelines.
► Ensure an accurate and timely monthly, quarterly and year end closing and reporting.
► Provide necessary information and data required by the Auditors (Statutory & Internal)
► Ensure the quarterly reviews and annual auditing as per the management deadlines.
► Proper Accounting, monitoring and reconciliation for Intercompany transactions.
► Monitoring and reporting related party transactions.
► Ensuring timely collection from debtors.
► Recommend for appropriate provisions for bad debts on a consistent basis as per the company policy.
► Controls on records keeping, proper filing and documentation.
► Ensuring appropriate provisions for Zakat & VAT and coordinating for final Certificates from the GAZT.
► Coordinate with consultant for Withholding Tax (WHT) clearance and submitting necessary documents for WHT provisions. Ensuring compliance with WHT rules on monthly and quarterly basis.
► Inventory valuation and ageing analysis.

The Transportation Coordinator and Personal Driver to the Partner will be responsible for coordinating and providing transportation services for the company by managing the daily schedule of office drivers, they are also responsible for personally chauffeuring the senior Partner and their family in a safe, efficient, and professional manner. MAIN JOB OBJECTIVE
Responsible for overseeing day-to-day operational effectiveness of retail stores within the assigned region, as well as developing and leading the operations strategy for the region by partnering with the corporate Sales team. The scope of the role includes, but is not limited to: inventory control, maintenance and store upkeep, operations team recruitment and development, on boarding and training, asset protection, policy enforcement, and store planning projects.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Policy and Procedures
Ensure that all operational policies and procedures are kept up-to-date.
Develop strategy to measure and ensure that all employees are trained in operations policies and procedures. This responsibility includes both new hires as well as tenured employees.
Ensure that all policies are enforced by Management throughout the region.
Ensure that stores are audit-ready at all times.
Store Facility/Store Planning
Liaise with store planning personnel on all store projects, construction, minor works, and renovations.
Support Operations Managers to ensure effective project management of store projects.
Build and maintain relationships with sub-contractors and vendors and ensure that stores are provided with necessary information.
Ensure that Operations Managers and Store Managers are maintaining interior and exterior premises.
Ensure that all equipment and parts are ordered on time from MIS, Store Planning, etc., to support the business effectively.
Ensure that the store management is maintaining all store equipment. Establish maintenance contracts where necessary.
Point person for handling all aspects of store Openings, Closings, Expansions and/or Renovations.
Financial
Ensure that stores control store expenses and ensure accurate records.
Ensure that proper procedures are being met with regard to cash, credit card and check processing, and petty cash.
Inventory
Support Operations Managers with the scheduling and coordination of inventory and cycle counts.
Provide support and training to stores as it relates to proper inventory preparation.
Reiterate and support the corporate directives in regard to inventories and cycle counts.
Human Resources/Asset Protection
Support the region with interviewing and hiring operations staff.
Support Sales and Human Resources on performance management of Operations staff, making recommendations when necessary and supporting Management with performance management when needed.
Work to develop clear succession plan for operations function, at the Regional level.
Collaborate with and support Asset Protection department in all areas of risk management, physical security, employee issues, store cash controls, inventory management, inter-store communication, and audits.
Liaise with stores and security vendors to ensure appropriate security coverage and contracts are place.
Retail Performance
Evaluate operations in the region on a regular basis and make process improvement or simplification recommendations to reduce workload for the stores and ensure that standards are maintained.
Support zone TIPS strategies, make zone-level recommendations, and train and implement when necessary.
Information Systems
Support region on training of new system roll-outs.
All other job-related activities.

Company Profile
Metropolitan School of Business and Management, UK, is a British Business school headquartered in London, the United Kingdom. MSBM is a Pathway College offering international students access to level 4, 5, and 7 Diploma leading to a University Degree from top UK Universities at an attractive cost. The school engages in a blended learning model that is both online and classroom. MSBM combines the most recent technology, quality curriculum, and innovative teaching channel to provide outstanding learning knowledge to its students.
Position Objectives
An admission counselor cum sales executive will direct and counsel the students towards the executive programs offered by the institute. Oversee and generate the leads from the potential market; work as a team and direct towards closing the deal over the phone and maintain good customer relationships.
An effective telesales representative must be an excellent communicator and have superior people skills. The candidate must be comfortable presenting the courses and services over the phone along with handling the complaints and doubts.
The core goal is to assist the company’s growth by bringing potential clients and promoting the business internationally.
Key Duties/Responsibilities
Managing, tracking, and following up on leads by calling them to give them a brief about the courses being offered by the organization.
Build a network that can promote and help to create better leads.
Give counseling to the students, by helping them understand the functioning of the pathway institute and the worthiness of the courses being offered.
Answer all the doubts that clients are having and give them a clear picture of the courses.
Ask questions to understand customers’ requirements and close.
Take and process the orders in an accurate manner.
Ability to meet deadlines each month.
Enter and update the clients’ information on the company portal.
Go the “extra mile” to meet the sales requirements and facilitate sales in the future.
Keep records of every conversation made and note all the possible information.
Essential Skills
Proven record of educational service telesales representative or customer service role.
Effective track record of successfully getting clients preferably over the phone calls.
Knowledge of potential sales market.
Ability to adapt the technology
Excellent active listening and communication skills.
Confident to handle the clients over calls.
Cool tempered and ability to accept and handle rejections.
Outstanding negotiation skills with an ability to resolve and address complaints.
Should be familiar with the locations in UAE and the courses being offered by various other pathway colleges in and around.
Qualification and Experience
Minimum of 2 years experience as a sales executive handling the international market.
At least a graduate degree holder.
Fluency in English is necessary
Good knowledge of MS Office especially MS Excel.
Versatile and is up to date with the trends of the market.
Ability to adapt and learn about the courses and services offered by the institute and describe/explain them to prospects.

Clinic Managers are responsible for overseeing the daily operations of outpatient or medical facilities. They provide administrative support and oversee the hiring and training of staff members, liaise with patients and healthcare professionals and coordinate patient care plans. There are many different routes one may take to become a Clinic Manager, but working in a healthcare or clinical setting is the most common way.
Responsible for the overall management of the facility’s front office, billing/ accounting, insurance and support services. Outpatient services are monitored and doctors’ clinics are scheduled in a way that promotes the continuity of patient care and systematic flow of facility’s operations. Flow of patients’ medical records and release of medical information are monitored as per company standards. Oversees the management of the facility’s accounting including debtors days. Consolidates daily sales reports with analysis and ensures that senior management is informed of significant variations. Exercise overall cost effective budgetary control over purchases and expenditure supplies. Liaises with Insurance companies on matters related to claims, approvals and dispatch and also conduct a periodic analysis on disallowances and resubmission. Sees to it that insurance authorizations are monitored to ensure it is done accurately and on time. Preparation of annual revenue expenditure and capital budgets, identification of potential cost reduction areas and implementation of the requisite measures. Responsible for the performance management, continuous improvement and quality management of these areas, based on organizational values. Ensures that a service culture is actively promoted within the Medical Center. Should ensure patient satisfaction is monitored and assessed. Should build up a mutual beneficial relationship with relevant medical aids and suppliers

Job Title: Calibration Services Manager
Job Type: Full-time
Job Description:
We are seeking an experienced Calibration Manager to join our team. The Calibration Manager will be responsible for overseeing the calibration of all instruments and equipment used in our facility and ensure accurate and reliable results. The Calibration Manager will also manage a team of technicians and coordinate with other departments to ensure that all instruments are calibrated on time and in accordance with applicable standards and regulations.
Responsibilities:
· Manage the calibration process for all instruments and equipment used in our facilities.
· Ensure that all clients instruments are calibrated on time and in accordance with applicable standards and regulations
· Manage a team of calibration technicians and provide guidance and training as needed.
· Work with other departments to ensure that all instruments are calibrated before use
· Develop and implement procedures for the calibration process
· Maintain records of all calibration activities and ensure that all records are accurate and up to date
· Identify and resolve any calibration-related issues faced by clients.
· Stay up to date with changes in calibration standards and regulations
· Manage the department calibration budget.
Requirements:
· Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g. engineering, physics, chemistry) or equivalent work experience
· 5+ years of experience in calibration management or a related field
· Strong knowledge of calibration standards and regulations
· Experience managing a team of calibration technicians
· Excellent communication, organizational, and problem-solving skills
· Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously
· Attention to detail and accuracy
· Knowledge of ISO 17025 and/or ISO 9001 quality management systems is a plus
If you are a self-motivated and detail-oriented Calibration Manager with a passion for accuracy and quality, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the opportunity to work with a dynamic and innovative team. Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your qualifications and experience.
We look forward to hearing from you!
Job Type: Full-time

operations management

Manage projects within specified scope, schedule and budget while meeting or exceeding quality standards.

To have previous experience in dealing with subcontractor agreements.
Monitor and evaluate the skills, attitudes, attendance, etc. of the workforce monthly to improve their performance on site.
Ensure health and safety procedures are strictly followed on site.

The successful candidate's primary function will be to manage all aspects of the company, handling day to day operations and maintaining positive cash flow.
You will be hands on and experienced in construction with excellent commercial awareness.
Increase profits and manage budgets.
Report directly to the CEO.
Attending the company construction sites and manage the works there form A to Z.
Identify and understand new creative ideas to help satisfy clients' construction projects

Understanding of business processes and knowledge/product services.
Create and mentor a diverse and effective leadership team.
Improve and maintain operational standards.
Committed to maintaining effective working relationships throughout the company.
Manage all legal obligations, compliance and warranties.
To oversee financial budgets, coordinate contractors and manage the construction process and be responsible for organizing schedules, tracking inventory and ordering and managing materials.

Coordinate subcontractors and construction team to meet contractual performance terms

Communicate with the responsible authorities to ensure quality construction exceeds company and proper standards industry technologies and processes are used, while ensuring that the client's needs and wants are met efficiently he met.
Review projects daily to ensure construction quality standards are in place and estimates remain within the budget.

Hiring contractors to work with architects, and sellers.

DM approved civil engineer

We are looking for a resilient, empathic business development executive to contribute to the growth of our company. Business development executives are responsible for finding and retaining clients, encouraging extant clients to purchase added products or features, and remaining abreast of changes in consumption. You will also be required to build capacity in staff through regular training and mentorship.
To be successful as a business development executive, you should attend networking events with the intention of attracting and retaining clientele. Ultimately, an outstanding business development executive will keep a close eye on clients' feedback to ensure that our products and services always exceed expectations.
Responsibilities:
Procuring new clients through direct contact, word-of-mouth, and collaboration with the marketing department.
Attending networking activities to research and connect with prospective clients.
Maintaining meaningful relationships with existing clients to ensure that they are retained.
Crafting business proposals and contracts to draw in more revenue from clients.
Negotiating with clients to secure the most attractive prices.
Reviewing clients' feedback and implementing necessary changes.
Remaining in tune with trends in consumption to ensure that our offerings remain relevant.
Requirements:
Degree in marketing, business administration, or similar.
2-3 years sales experience in UAE.
Intuitive and insightful, particularly regarding human behavior.
Ability to generate revenue by identifying pain points and suggesting suitable products or services.
Neat, well-groomed appearance.
Great networking skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication.
Resourceful, with outstanding research skills.
Emboldened by challenges.

Role Summary
Looking for a dedicated, enthusiastic, committed, and dynamic teacher to join the department at School.
The primary role of a teacher is to deliver classroom instruction that helps students learn. To accomplish this, teachers must prepare effective lessons, grade student work and offer feedback, manage classroom materials, productively navigate the curriculum, and collaborate with other staff. The main goals are to help students progress in their academics, learn to take responsibility for their assignments and encourage necessary life skills that carry into adulthood.
About SSIS
Shining Star International School is a high performing International School in Abu Dhabi, fully accredited with CBSE- the largest examination conducting entity in the world..
Our students receive a sound and holistic education across a wide range of subjects and extra-curricular activities, which helps them to develop and hone a broad range of skills.
Shining Star International School is all inclusive private school established in 2014 in Musaffah, Abu Dhabi. Currently serving the needs of the local and international expatriate community it follows the CBSE curriculum and its students are encouraged to embark on a voyage of discovery that uncovers hidden talents in their niche areas of interest.
As they grow our ‘Shining Stars’ become beacons of light within their own peer groups and are taught how to use the knowledge and wisdom gained during their time in the school to benefit the people they associate with and the world at large.
Key Work Responsibilities
· Implement instructional activities that contribute to a climate where students are actively engaged in meaningful learning experiences.
· Inform students of disciplinary rules set by the School and personally make sure that any misconduct is handled appropriately.
· Ensure proper maintenance of school properties. Take full responsibility for damages, if any, in their class room property and report the cause of damage of the facility immediately or else take the responsibility to replace or fix the damage.
· Identify, select and modify instructional resources to meet the needs of the students with varying backgrounds, learning styles, and special needs.
· Maintain effective and efficient record keeping procedures.
· Provide a positive environment in which students are encouraged to be actively engaged in the learning process.
· Ensure the note books and assessment papers are corrected and recorded for performance tracking, progress recording and for future reference.
· Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with students, parents and other professionals on a regular basis.
· Collaborate with colleagues to enhance the instructional environment, establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with students, parents and the school.
· Model professional and ethical standards when dealing with students, parents, colleagues and community.
· Assume responsibility for meeting their course and school-wide students’ performance goals.
· Demonstrate progress in student performance.
· Participate in training and presentations on online teaching.
· Meet professional obligations through efficient work habits such as: meeting deadlines, honoring schedules and coordinating.
· Participate in extracurricular activities such as social activities, sporting activities, House and student organizations.
· Participate in department and school meetings, parent meetings.
· Keep updated with developments in subject area, teaching resources and methods and make relevant changes to instructional plans and activities.
· Identify and select different instructional resources and methods to meet students' varying needs.
· Understand that responsibilities are subject to having performance goals and targets established as part of the annual performance planning process or as the result of organizational planning.
· Prepares and moderates question papers for school examinations.
· Upload Lesson Plans-weekly plans, Mid Term Plans, Yearly plans, worksheets, School academic calendar, events and activity calendar ,Circulars and notices in the school ERP portal( Eth –DC)
· Perform other responsibilities which may be assigned by the school authorities from time to time.
· Responsible for Academic excellence of students.
· Collaborates with peers for the purpose of implementing and maintaining curricular and co-curricular programs for students and personal development
· Participates in peer observation and performance tracking.
Benefits
Excellent Remuneration Package, Competitive tax-free salary, 50% of on child education, private medical insurance, end of Service Gratuity, paid holidays.

Job Summary
Bird farm managers specialize in breeding birds of various types, ranging from exotic species to poultry. They breed birds and sell them to pet shops, customers, or export them to various countries.
The basic duties of a bird-farm manager include protecting the birds from their natural enemies, ensuring that the birds are healthy by feeding them and sheltering them from extreme weather conditions, such as strong winds that may damage or destroy their nests.
Bird farmers need to ensure that every bird is kept in an environment that is similar to its habitat.
If a bird farmer keeps chickens or other poultry, they shelter the newly hatched chicks in brooder houses. When the chicks are seven or eight weeks old, they are moved to pens. After six months, roosters are culled for meat and the hens begin to lay eggs.
They need to have an extensive knowledge of various bird species and their anatomy to run successful bird farms. They also need to be able to detect when birds are unstable, or uncomfortable in any way. They can detect a bird’s odd behaviour by comparing it to its normal pattern.
Job Description
Oversee the daily well-being condition of the birds in the farm
Be the point of contact for any supplies, changes, situations and visitors in the assigned area of farm (birds’ area)
Lead staff team in making sure nutrition needs of birds are met and that they are fed timely with a balanced meal, avoiding any biosecurity issue.
Take care of the breeding & production seasons for wild birds in consideration of the weather where globally migratory birds come to the farm
Train farm staff new joiners on animal first aid, proper animal interactions and

JOB SUMMARY:
Establish and utilize integrated pest management strategies to develop systems/protocols that result in disease and insect pests below economic thresholds. Supervise all applications and training to ensure safe use in compliance with current law. Support Agritek Mission Statement in all job related functions.
Job Description
· Assist farm staff in scouting and diagnosing pests, nutrient deficiencies, and other issues that may be detrimental to farm health throughout Farm and production areas.
· Supervise and document all pesticide applications
· Assist in Soil, Water, and any necessary tissue sampling
· Assisting in the coordination of pest management personnel, ensuring that all Agritek Farms, Global Farm employees who perform pest control have the necessary training, are equipped with the appropriate personal protective equipment, and have the necessary licenses for their pest management responsibilities.
· Maintaining a prioritized list of needed structural and landscape improvements in regard to IPM.
· Assist staff in maintaining pesticide applicators license through classes and continuing education classes.
· Ensure all areas that are to be sprayed are posted and have re-entry times.
· Ensure that any contractor who is doing pest control provides pest control proposal specifications are compatible with IPM principles, and that pest control contractors work under the guidelines of Agritek/Global Farm’s IPM policy.
· Ensuring that all pesticides used on Agritek Farms property are in compliance with UAE OHS.
· Coordinate and record all information and timing for all sprays on leased land and own farms.
· Keep current pesticide labels, and Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS).
· Maintain accurate pesticide application records for all pesticide applications, in accordance with OHS; research and begin adding these documents to allow them to be accessed and completed via Farm ERP system.
· Authorizing and/or reviewing least hazardous, effective emergency treatments with licensed applicators
· Coordinate and assist with designing and implementing a Comprehensive Nutrient Management Plans
· Handling requests and inquiries relating to pest problems.
· Maintain records of any pesticide related complaints.
· Ensure that files are maintained regarding pesticide application records, and incidental use reports.
· Informing administrators and other personnel about IPM requirements (e.g., training requirements, pre-notification and posting requirements, sanitation, and pesticide storage).
· Maintaining an updated copy of Agritek Farms IPM policy.
· Develop a comprehensive IPM plan including; bio controls, beneficial insects, natural predators, trapping, vacuuming, and spraying
· Assist in preparation of estimates for budget of pest control needs and/or pesticides.
· Maintain an accurate record of Pesticides on site.
· Responsible for ordering pesticides and other pest control methods.
· Review current pesticide use to lessen chemical dependence with a mind to cycle active ingredients and remove any unnecessary chemicals from use
· Review and assess compliance on a annual basis
· Responsible for ensuring fertilizer use complies with UAE Agri policies.
· Perform other duties as they arise from necessity.
Physical Requirements: • Ability to lift 75 pounds • Willingness and ability to perform physical work outside in all weather conditions • Ability to carry, climb, push, stoop, reach, dig, and to load and unload various objects • Ability to operate various power tools and heavy equipment as needed.
Working conditions: • The majority of time will be spent working outside in the garden, though some office work is also required. • Summers are hot and humid. Open farms are in the deserts.

Job Title: Stylist
Job Descriptions:
- help the clients choose their dresses for any occasion and create unique looks from head to toe. Combine fashion knowledge with a customer service attitude to help clients prepare themselves for their special day. Able to provide fashion advice for different looks.

· Providing a warm & hospitable welcome of clients.

· Assisting customers with fittings and alterations, when required.

· Schedule dress fittings with clients.
· Coordinate delivery, pick-up and return of dresses.
· Maintain database of clients and provide information for all customer sales and analyze same.

· Staying updated on the latest trends related to bridal and fashion industry.

- Professional and experienced employee.
- A least (2) years of experience in fashion and styling industry.
- Qualified or studied fashion stylist. It will be excellent if the candidate worked in one of the luxury boutiques or as an assistant to any of the fashion designers.
Skills
· Communication skills – good communication skills and able to connect and communicate with people in a professional way. escalate issues to the appropriate boutique staff or management.
· Styling – creative and understand how to style a person based on her skin color, height, body etc….
· Organization skills – coordinating delivery, pickup, alterations, appointments and meetings. Capable of time management.
· Administration skills –such as answering telephones, filling out paperwork, and arranging appointments, enter customer information into databases for customer service and follow-up.
· Problem-solving skills – a willingness to go above and beyond when solving problems related to work issues and last minute changes with clients. Able to resolve issues promptly and efficiently.
